main event: On 12-7-58 in Syracuse, N.Y., a ground-radar observation detected an unidentified object moving from West to East, appearing as a radar blip and then disappearing within 2-3 minutes.
interesting points: The observation was made using ground-radar equipment in Syracuse, N.Y. during the evening of 12-7-58.
The unidentified object appeared as a radar blip and moved in a straight course from West to East before disappearing.
The observation lasted for 2-3 minutes, indicating a brief sighting of the unidentified object.
The weather at the time of the observation was reported as clear and unlimited, with scattered winds and no mention of abnormal aircraft traffic in the area.
The observation was made by a Chief Controller (Pilot) and was considered an unknown ground-visual case.
witnesses: H.R. Sandusky, Capt., Ret 2.25th AD (Chief Controller, Pilot)
